Source code for qt_custom.qt_extra

# subclass
'''This module contains classes and functions that add added custom made widgets and functionalities to the qt GUI. It contains the
following components:

**Classes:**
.. autosummary::
   :toctree: _autosummary

    CheckableComboBox
'''

### Import needed modules ###
from PyQt5 import QtGui, QtCore, QtWidgets
import sys, os


# Note: Add all option that selects all items

###################################################################
### CheckableComboBox Class                                     ###
###################################################################

[docs]class CheckableComboBox(QtWidgets.QComboBox):

    def __init__(self, default_text_holder=None):
        super(CheckableComboBox, self).__init__()
        self.default_text_holder = default_text_holder

        ### Setup default textholder ###
        if default_text_holder:
            super(CheckableComboBox, self).addItem(default_text_holder)


[docs]    def setDefaultTextHolder(self, default_text_holder):

        if default_text_holder:  # If default text holder already exists
            self.default_text_holder = default_text_holder
            item = self.model().item(0,0)
            item.setText(default_text_holder)
        else:
            pass


    # once there is a checkState set, it is rendered
    # here we assume default Unchecked

[docs]    def addItem(self, item):
        super(CheckableComboBox, self).addItem(item)
        item = self.model().item(self.count()-1,0)
        item.setFlags(QtCore.Qt.ItemIsUserCheckable | QtCore.Qt.ItemIsEnabled)
        item.setCheckState(QtCore.Qt.Unchecked)



[docs]    def itemChecked(self, index):
        item = self.model().item(i,0)
        return item.checkState() == QtCore.Qt.Checked
